text: dance is a is a uni Universal form of
communication um it doesn't matter what
language you speak everyone um can
understand um certain aspects of of
movement um I think for me I would I
grew up in a sort of theatrical family
so I was definitely headed for the
theater and um I started taking ballet
classes when I was pretty young SE I was
seven years old and I saw it on TV and
it just appealed to me I don't really
know why um I guess I liked the costumes
and it was actually a ballet that had
chickens in it so I remember thinking it
would be cool to be a chicken that's
kind of a strange thing I know but
um and it's an amazing thing to be able
to uh hear music and kind of I guess be
able to translate that music through um
physicality and then somehow make that
translation um seem resonant to a viewer
to an audience member um and that's kind
of what drove me from becoming from
being a dancer to becoming a
choreographer um that sort of desire to
somehow move people or transport them
somewhere through this you know this
fantastic um unspoken art form I
describe sometimes choreography like a a
way of visualizing or painting music for
for an audience um quite often you can
take a really complex piece of music
that you might sit down at home and or
you know turn on the radio and hear as
being
um very sort of rhythmically complex or
atonal or not particularly attractive to
the ear and you take a a piece like that
and you start to sort of sculpt it using
bodies um it can become really
accessible uh to an audience that
way well I don't really I don't really
use my choreography to
um
to sort of uh announce any kind of
political agenda or you know what I do
is really is really try to create uh
Escape for people to create a world
that's that's um that can be challenging
in whatever way but um that ultimately
is uh is kind of beauty through movement
and and
music
um I guess my process some
choreographers like to work on
themselves you know they go into a room
and uh with with a particular idea or a
piece of music and they and they work on
the material on the steps on their own
bodies and then they call answers in at
a later date and kind of work with them
and shape it onto them I prefer to do it
directly onto the dancers themselves um
I find kind of standing in the room
staring at myself in the mirror pretty
uninspiring whereas if I've got two
really beautiful people or four or six
or eight really beautiful people there
that often my interaction with them is
sort of the starting point or the
Catalyst for you know how the work
develops
